name: The Oberoi Amarvilas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without hesitation the best hotel in the area. We could see the Taj Mahal from our room, and the rest of the hotel was like "your own Taj Mahal". Impressive arquitecture and excellence in service. Good food, not the best, but very good. Our room was really gorgeours and didn't miss any detail.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Agra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you plan on visiting the Taj Mahal, staying in this hotel is more than worthy.
reviews.title: Amazing Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have a nice trip!
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Great Food and Great Location! Spent half day with my few of colleagues while on a business trip to Delhi. We just went in for lunch. One thing that did upset me was that they allowed us inside just for lunch only after seeing few foreigners along with us. Despite that, the service and the food did compensate that rude behavior from the folks at the entrance (security staff).
reviews.title: Best terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stumped up big bucks to stay at this top hotel because of its unrivalled views of the Taj Mahal and weren't disappointed by the quality of the accommodation, the recreational facilities or the hospitality. You could easily visit Agra and not leave this hotel which has a superb pool, gym and beautiful gardens. The food was also excellent, particulary at Esphahan where we enjoyed a vegetarian thali that was a taste sensation. The paneer (cottage cheese) served in a spinach sauce in the hotel's Bellevue restaurant was the culinary revelation of our visit to India. I can't think of a negative thing to say about this place. Thanks Oberoi for making our visit to Agra a fantastic and unforgettable experience.
reviews.title: Wow....what a sensational view!
Amazing Honeymoon Backdrop
reviews.text: We stayed here a few nights for our honeymoon as we had read such great reviews on trip advisor. We emailed in advance to let them know it was our honeymoon and we were very lucky to be upgraded as the hotel was actually fully booked on one of the nights of our stay. We enjoyed the food in the restaurant but we especially enjoyed having room service breakfasts and thoroughly spoiling ourselves and being able to look at the changing colours of the Taj Mahal from our balcony. In fact when we went to see it close up we did not stay very long as we almost enjoyed the view from the hotel more. The hotel public spaces are scented with Jasmine oil and I have since smelt fresh Jasmine and was immediately taken back to the time we spent there. We enjoyed the pool and they have a good gym.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon trip.
reviews.title: Wonderful honeymoon stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel was great and service was impeccable! This hotel was perhaps one of the best we have ever stayed in, in the several countries we have traveled to. The pool was amazing, service was top-notch, and we were upgraded to a room with a private balcony with a view of the Taj! Very highly-recommended!
reviews.title: The only luxury option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Important tip for other travelers - our 2-week trip to India was made much more convenient and pleasant by hiring a private driver, which really made our trip fantastic and made traveling through India much easier and enjoyable. We booked through this website and were taken care of by the owner himself, Ramesh Kumar, who has 15 years of experience in driving all over India. He was very professional and accommodating, speaks excellent English, and exceeded all expectations!
reviews.title: A once in a lifetime experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: http://www.letsgoindiatours.com/
reviews.title: Best Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel extensively and this hotel is as fine as any we have stayed in around the world. The facility is extraordinarily well maintained; spotless floors, handrails, bathrooms and common areas. Our room was well appointed and exceptionally comfortanble. The unobstructed view of the Taj Mahal from our room and the terrace bar added to our overall enjoyment of the experience.The food and service in the restaurants was excellent. I will recommend this hotel unconditionally to family, friends and colleagues.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Their common area such as the lobby, gardens and pool were beautiful and grand. But we were fairly disappointed by how simple our room is. Although we did get one of their cheapest rooms, so we couldn't really complain. The shower pressure was very strong but the water doesn't drain quickly enough so it got flooded easily. We did however have a balcony with a view of the Taj Mahal and a good view of the pool and gardens. The check in was prompt and effortless. We were even greeted personally by the GM. The breakfast spread was delectable. The best I have had in a long while. Do ask for their freshly squeezed orange juice. On the morning that we were checking out. Brown water came out of our bathroom tap. Fortunately my sister and I had already had our shower. The staff seemed very professional and attentive. However we felt that they lack warmth and sincerity shown by the other hotels that we have stayed at in India.
reviews.title: beautiful view of the Taj

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the exterior of the hotel at the entrance is quite special, the rest of the hotel is so/so.
reviews.title: Nothing special but very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Pros: closest location to Taj Mahal of any quality hotel which is very useful for early morning tours, golf buggy takes you as close to the East Gate entrance as is possible, a remote but still impressive view of the Taj Mahal from your room (if lucky).
reviews.title: A very special hotel - wonderful service, wonderful food and the most amazing views of the Taj Mahal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Cons: average rooms, very thin walls/doors to the extent you can hear your neighbours speak quite clearly, impersonal service given that most guests seem to come and go in a day.
reviews.title: Best in Agra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here only for a night to visit the Taj Mahal. We were driven 5 1/2 hours from Delhi so we can visit the monument the next morning and a few other sites. Agra itself is very congested, smoggy and a bit run down. This hotel however is like an oasis in the midst of it all. It is a very welcome retreat that is so close to the Taj Mahal. We were greeted warmly when we arrived with welcome drinks, chilled towels and the concierge does your registration in your room so you can settle down as soon as you arrive which is such a nice touch! Our room with balcony was absolutely gorgeous. The furniture and decor is so tasteful. We didn't go for a swim but walked by the beautiful pool. The outdoor area is stunning. In the evening, there's a performance that begins at 6pm. It was a nice touch since we stayed in that evening. The breakfast buffet had everything you can you ask for and hit the spot after a sunrise tour at the Taj Mahal. The golf cart ride made it all so convenient. The service here is impeccable and if we were to visit Agra again, this will be the place to stay.
reviews.title: The best hotel to stay in when visiting the Taj Mahal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel must have been one of the most luxurious places I've visited in Asia. The whole hotel is built up with so much attention of luxe and details - with a stunning swimming pool - your own butler - and not to be forgotten, a view from every room on the Taj Mahal...(if there is no smog...). I've probably taken an equal amount of photo's of the hotel than of the Taj Mahal itself...
reviews.title: pure luxe .... with a view on the Taj Mahal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and myself didn't want to leave anymore...except we certainly did not have the budget for an additional night either...
reviews.title: Views of the Taj Mahal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only remark I would make is that, based on the multiple reviews about the superb quality of the indian restaurant, we reserved our table as well - and, although, the diner was certainly worthwile (and very expensive), we managed to find better restaurants during our stay in India.
reviews.title: Holy cow - this place is just the bizness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But for the rest, luxury, high personal service and fine attention for the details...we loved it!
reviews.title: Taj Mahal from the Bedroom !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The elegance of a stay at the Oberoi Amarvilas in Agra cannot be matched. Every room has a view of the Taj Mahal, which is surely unique in the world. The staff are gracious, and the hotel is magnificently appointed.
reviews.title: World-Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only quibble I would have is that the service in the breakfast room is rather slow. The waitstaff are well-meaning hotel management trainees who have probably never had experience as waiters in less elegant surroundings.
reviews.title: P-e-r-f-e-c-t

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In any event, your stay at the Amarvilas will be beautifully memorable.
reviews.title: lap of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff could not do enough and would do anything that you asked them to do.
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel

likes.disliked: — There was nothing not to like about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hospitality was serious and perfect. They escorted you to the Taj Mahal by a back street on their golf cart and their guard was there to greet you and walk you to the gate to avoid peddlers. Again they were there to walk you upon your return.
reviews.title: See the taj from the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellent as were the meals. The architecture and decor of the hotel are stylish -if a touch over-stated - and the ratio of space to guests is exceptional. THE feature, however, is and must be the views of the Taj from the ground floor lounge and from every bedroom. They really are out of this world. A true luxury experience and one to be savoured!
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in a Premier Balcony room which gave a wonderful view of the iconic Taj Mahal. The room was really comfortable and looked out onto beautiful gardens with the tomb in the background. The only negative was that sitting outside on the balcony was noisy as there was a religious festival taking place.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay coincided with Mother's Day and the hotel sent some lovely biscuits with a chocolate greeting plaque - nice touch!.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the all day dining restaurant and enjoyed good food with a wide range of choice. I used the spa and had a lovely massage but sadly did not have time to sit by the pool. The pool area looked very inviting!
reviews.title: Once In A Lifetime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With its proximity to the Taj Mahal, fabulous grounds and wonderful staff this really is a stunning hotel. Beware if you want to connect to the internet as it is expensive!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only place to stay in Agra and it is fabulous.
reviews.title: A gracious apology made for a wondeful stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked for two nights in a twin room. Originally we were given a double and a few problems occurred when we were moved to the twin that dissapointed us given the excellent reviews and also the cost. Also the pool, which we were assured was heated ,was cold, heating system had broken down but customer relations did not know.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Stay Ever

likes.liked: — the rooms, the view and the service
likes.disliked: — there was nothing to conplain about except that we didn't stay long enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wrote a letter to the hotel manager who met us the following evening and with a gracious apology said he would only charge us for one night. On returning to our room after viewing the Taj Mahal by moonlight there were flowers, wine and a birthday cake, hubby's 60th. A lovely gesture and much appreciated.
reviews.title: Paradise - for a fee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the views from our balcony and the dancing in the evening. There is no problem with the local town or the park outside. Yes local people do make there presence felt but its mainly by singing and playing music and generally having a good time, so just enjoy it. The Indian restaurant is lovely, although a bit too much chilli for my taste even though requested the chef tone it right down.
reviews.title: oberoi at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff and service are excellent and everyone went out of their way to help, give advice and have a chat. The golf cart ride to the Taj Mahal helped avoid the touts and our driver got us our tickets. Customer services also picked up our moonlight visit tickets which we had booked by email before we left Uk.
reviews.title: Well worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. The entire place is gorgeous and extravagant. The excellent service by every member of the staff was out of this world. Each one address us my name and provided personal touches. Amazing place!
reviews.title: Service cannot be beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is one of the gorgeous looking buildings with expansive grounds which are just as lovely. The staff was very professional, yet friendly. The hotel has a no tipping policy which we thought was really great.
reviews.title: One of best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A minor detail which just made the visit extra special was that they will deliver DVDs to your room (to borrow). The list of DVDs was extensive and included current as well as classic material. Along with the DVD, they delivered a large bowl of popcorn!
reviews.title: What better place for room service?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at each of the three locations which had food, all were exceptional. We had breakfast in the Bellevue, a light meal in the bar, and a fantastic Indian dinner in the Esphahan.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have ever stayed in......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is located a short distance from the Taj Mahal. The hotel has complimentary golf cart service to and from the hotel.
reviews.title: Its the place to stay if you are in Agra !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel and grounds are as gorgeous as you see in photographs, but the beauty is negated by the fact that I woke up in my room at 11 p.m. smelling smoke to the point I had to use an inhaler because I couldn't breathe (and I am not an asthmatic, nor have I ever had breathing problems).Everyone in the hall was coughing as well. I was in India for 10 days and grew acclimated to the smell of burning trash at night, but Agra was by far the worst in this regard. Go to the Taj Mahal, have lunch at the Oberoi, then continue on your travels without staying the night in Agra.
reviews.title: Gorgeous but smell of burning trash caused me to not be able to breathe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I find it unusually difficult to write a review of this hotel because there's nothing at all that I can find to criticize. The location is unique and the hotel-managed interface with the Taj Mahal site is ideal. The rooms are well-furnished, comfortable, quiet and immaculately clean. The food is great. The service at every level is "high touch" -- for example, upon arrival I recounted a problem with the travel arrangements to/from Agra made by a hotel in another city, and it was immediately solved for me by the Amarvilas management.
reviews.title: Perfect in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is expensive but for once I'd say it's worth it every penny paid.
reviews.title: awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there for 3 nights with 2 of my colleagues. It was great stay. we had fun. we wanted to extend our trip but couldn't due to some work back home. I'll just say it was awesome .................................
reviews.title: Great location and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed only one night in Agra and could find no fault with this hotel. Its location is very convenient for the Taj Mahal which we could see from our room. The hotel was beautifully designed and everything functioned well - except for the IT breakdown on checking out. The staff were friendly and helpful and we left with a very positive impression.
reviews.title: Still best Hotel in Agra - but not what it used to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: yes it isnt the chepaest place on Earth, but with a view of the Taj from every room, it really is one of theose once in a lifetime experiences! service is second to none! it really is a mind blowing experience.
reviews.title: Like nothing you'll ever experience again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agra was stop off number 2 on our golden triangle tour of India before heading to Jaipur and then onto Goa. The train from Delhi to Agra was most definitely the way to travel (despite the fog which limited our views) as it gave you a small sense of normality outside the tourist bubble ( don't worry though no chickens/goats sharing frost class more like bored commuters a equally apprehensive looking tourists)
reviews.title: If you are going to Agra/Taj Mahal...Look no further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agra isn't that pretty, the Taj is spectacular and the Oberoi currently sits as one of the best run most professional hotels I have ever stayed at. The rooms, restaurants and pool are all excellent but the service culture is the thing that stays with me. Genuine interest in you as an individual and continual unobtrusive attempts to go beyond expectations appeared to be in every one of the hotel staff attitude that we came across....really impressive. I don't want to write down all the examples for fear they may become the norm or somehow undermine your experience but as a reasonably well travelled and cynical Yorkshireman this hotel really impressed me....my only advice would be go if you can afford it there is simply nowhere better in town and when you are there let your guard down and let this fabulous staff look after you.
reviews.title: oasis of perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a more practical note the balcony rooms are magnificent and the view of the Taj is something a bit special. The food in the hotel is geared toward predominantly Foreign/American taste so if you like your food with some flavour/spice then please let your server know....and be met by another genuine beaming smile .....tandoori Raan (leg of Lamb)and Biryani both "asian spiced" come with my recommendations.
reviews.title: Amazing views ... amazing staff!!!
Speechless
reviews.text: Best Hotel of the Holiday - Thank you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night, to visit the Taj. We choose the Oberoi because they advertised that every room had a view of the Taj, and since we could only stay for one night (and wanted to see the Taj at Sunrise), we decided that paying the extra (as compared to the Sheraton, which was significantly less) for the sunset view from our room would be worth it. It was a good decision. They upgraded us to a room with a balcony, and it had a stunning view of the Taj. The room was nice (not the best ever, but good), with a nice bed, great bathroom, and great patio. Food in the restaurant was good (we had dinner and breakfast there). They were super attentive. There is a golf cart which will take you to the gate of the Taj and then pick you up. The pool was incredible, one of the nicest pools I've ever seen and swam in,
reviews.title: Taj views and amazing pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived in Agra having stayed at the Imperial in Delhi and the Rambagh Palace in Jaipur. Expectations were high, but not met. The rooms in the Amervilas are small and somewhat outdated, and the corridors are dark with a low ceiling. And yes, the view is great, but I cannot help feeling that without the view the hotel would have had to be much better to justify a 5 star rating.
reviews.title: A fabulous view, but not much more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is friendly but not as consistent as in the two hotels mentioned earlier. The food in their Indian specialty restaurant was not particularly good and the ambience in the restaurant is strange and was not to our liking. To me it was a relief each time the musicians took a break unfortunatley they appeared to be paid by the hour.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel but something was lacking for me and communication between staff is poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very convenient for a visit to the Taj, and the transfer service worked fine. In the admittedlu unlikely event that I return to Agra I will attempt to fine a better hotel.
reviews.title: Better than expected and WOW what a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel, very luxurious and the pool is fabulous. We stayed here as part of a tour of The Golden Triange which we booked through Castle and King Inc who were excellent. It was they who recommended all the hotels to us.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: That a hotel like this can exist in a place like Agra is amazing. While Agra does have some nice old colonial architecture which you can spy while whizzing by in a car, there is not much else in the town to recommend it, other than the obvious world class tourist sites in the vicinity. Simply put, Agra is quite an unpleasant and dirty place, and the Oberoi is a fantastic refuge.
reviews.title: Amazing refuge in Agra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I think the most amazing aspects of this hotel are the views over the Taj Mahal from all of the rooms, and the fantastic grounds. Looking out from our balcony, I was totally wowed by what I saw. The pool is simply magnificent and huge. The surrounding Mughal style gardens were filled with fourntains and small flowing rivers of water. Peaceful and visually stunning. Perfection.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with Taj Mahal in sight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms of the hotel are also quite nice, although I did think our rooms were on the small side. The furnshings were Indian in style, but despite this, the room did seem a little lacking in personality. No major deficiency, but something just felt missing to me., In addition, I found the windows a bit shabby, with peeling and poorly applied a paint. It was a little incongruous with the rest of the room, which was very well kept. The bathrooms, however, are large, and very well equipped. Lovely large marble showers and amenities. These are nitpicky complaints, but for the price, the rooms are not the strongest suit of the hotel.
reviews.title: Simply amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I enjoyed the hotel's restaurants, and there aren't any good alternatives in the area, that I could see, so you are pretty much going to patronize the hotel's restaurants. Breakfast was good. In particular, we enjoyed the South Indian breakfast at the hotel. However, the breakfast service was quite uneven despite what appeared to be an adequate number of staff. One morning, it took us at least ten minutes to get a cup of coffee in an almost empty breakfast room. When the coffee finally arrived, it was cold. Staff did apologize, but the breakfast service could be improved.
reviews.title: Great facade, no substance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Indian restaurant for dinner was quite memorable, especially with the live sitar and tabla music which was provided nightly. The restaurant itself is richly decorated with Indian fabrics and is lovely. However, the food was uneven. The chicken curry which was advertised on the menu as spicy, barely had any flavour. When we mentioned this to the staff, they quickly removed the charge from our bill, which was quite unexpected. The second night we ate at the restaurant, the food was much better. I loved the Indian pancake dessert on the menu. It was delicious. And the music just transformed this dining experience into a simply sublime memory.
reviews.title: A Special Oberoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have been to many luxury hotels in India. In my opinion Oberai Amarivilas is one of the top 5 best hotels in India. Offers a great view of one of the 7 wonders of the world " Taj Mahal".
reviews.title: One of the top 5 best hotels in India

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Oberoi Amarvilas for three days and it was suppose to be the best days of my life. Great hospitality, Super luxury, amazing comfort, mindblowing interiors.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Views & stunning interior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Truly a commendable hotel. For foreigners must visit hotel in India.
reviews.title: the most beautiful view in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved this hotel and its breathtaking views over the Taj Mahal. Our room, whilst not one of the best in the hotel, was perfect for us in terms of decor and comfort. We ate in the Indian restaurant and had a delicious and generous meal. The service throughout the hotel was great with the friendly and willing staff that the Oberoi Hotel group train so well. However, there was one thing that should be mentioned - we noticed a faint smell of what we presumed to be sewage, which was worse at one end of the hotel than the other. It wasn't enough to spoil our stay but it was there.
reviews.title: Terrific property with some bumps in service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you walk into this hotel, you are able to see the Taj Mahal and you can't take your eyes off of it! From our room, the view was of the Taj and overlooking the beautiful pool and gardens. Service and food were great and the location allowed us to visit the Taj at both sunset and sunrise! Highly recommend, you can't go wrong.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, fantastic location, but ... a bit of food challenges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The view from our bedroom was stunning.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel grounds and setting was amazing. The staff were always attentive without being intrusive, Food was good but not exceptional, the swimming pool however was!.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definately recommend this hotel and a visit to the glorious Taj Mahal
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at 3 Oberoi hotels. In Agra, Jaipur and Udiapur. All were different, but all were unique in their own fashion. Glorious settings, fantastic rooms, the one in Jaipur had a sunken bath overlooking its own private garden. Incredible service. How do the staff know your name within such a short stay, 1 or 2 nights in each. Everywhere you are greeted by your name.and they cannot do enough to make your stay with each of these hotels more enjoyable. Hair dressing is good and cheap. spa treatments are similar prices to London but great.We are not great Indian food lovers but they encouraged us to taste different dishes.The position of each was perfect for touring. We had a view of the Taj Mahal from our bedroom.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really looking forward to our stay at this hotel and was not disappointed. What a setting - the views of the Taj Mahal from the balcony across the amazing garden and swimming pool were breathtaking. Everything about this hotel was wonderful, the staff, the room, the food etc. The hotel buggy takes you to the East Gate of the Taj Mahal which is a big plus as cars are not allowed. It was our wedding anniversary and on seeing our cards the housekeeping team left us a card, flowers and chocolates! A very special hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Views with airport hotel service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Amarvilas is a beautiful property. Extremely luxurious property with an ideal location, over-seeing the Taj Mahal.
reviews.title: Stay at Amarvilas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I enjoyed the dinner at the poolside. Sandeep Pande, the Exec Chef at the hotel is very Customer oriented and dishes out the most exotic food.
reviews.title: Enjoy Tajmahal 24x7 !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Look forward to my next visit to Amarvilas.
reviews.title: Oh my!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Amarvilas last weekend. It's simply amazing. All the rooms have Taj view!!! What more can one ask for....you open your eyes and the wonder of the world is there for you to appreciate. The hotel is a walking distance from the East gate of Tajmahal....however, the hotel buggy can also take you there. We were there on 12th Nov, which was a full moon night. The hotel had arranged for the night viewing tickets for us....it was very romantic and beautiful to see the moon-lit Taj minus the crowd. Oberoi service is one of the best. There is a live Kathak dance performance every evening, and the best part is that guests can enjoy the dance from their resp balconies!!! Just wished that for the amount they charged, they could have atleast included one dinner/ lunch !!
reviews.title: Amazing Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel redefines luxury. Be prepared to pay, but it really does need to be experienced once in a lifetime. They say every room has a view of the Taj Mahal... but they had fog the day I was there so I can't vouch to their claim.
reviews.title: what a location, what a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is THE place to stay in Agra. Every room has a view of the Taj Mahal. We were on the 4th floor with our balcony room aligned directly with the Taj. Everything is high-end opulence. The pool is spectacular with gold paint decorations. The hotel is lined with marble and crystal chandeliers. The room has plush beds with TVs and DVD players in which you can rent DVDs for free. Everyone was accommodating and our super late checkout was granted without hesitation. We took the train from Delhi to Agra, which leaves at 8pm so we essentially stayed two full days at the Amarvilas for the price of one night. All in all an amazing stay.
reviews.title: Best Hotel during our stay in India

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful room, a stunning hotel with the most beautiful details. Food was great, location could not be better and what immaculate grounds. We wish we could have stayed a bit longer to enjoy the hotel itself. Our only gripe was that we were without water for about 6 hours! We swam in the pool and the staff provided buckets of water for the toilet but this really was not satisfactory.
reviews.title: A wonderful treat; wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow. After a 5 hour drive we arrived at this welcome oasis slighly shell shocked. The hotel is Magnificent. Our room was on the top floor and the views(all rooms have one) of the Taj Mahal is breathtaking. Our room was FREEZING cold, but a heater was brought in, so it worked out fine. I cannot say enough about the service. The people working there are incredible and go the extra mile. The shops at the hotel are very good.
reviews.title: Magical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location - you can see the Taj Mahal from the lobby and your room if you are a little higher up
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice property - we were a bit disappointed we did not have more time to enjoy the hotel. The swimming pool is a very nice palce to relax and in general there seem to many cormers in the extensive gardens one woul like to spend some more time in.
reviews.title: Creepily empty and overpriced

description: The Taj Mahal is extraordinary as much for what it is as how it has escaped the banality of cliché. For 350 years, this monument evokes a sense of wonder. Only by being there can you witness its true majesty, its symmetry, its setting and the delicacy of its carved marble inlaid with precious stones. Now just suppose you were to overlook it from your hotel room? The Oberoi Amarvilas is 600 metres from this tribute to love. The lavish interiors and elaborate gardens add to the serenity of the scene. The guestrooms are palatial: all have magical views and are luxuriously furnished with traditional fabrics, white marble, hand-crafted ornaments and every modern amenity. There is a luxury spa offering a range of therapies, a swimming pool where snacks and drinks are served; an ornamented ballroom and fine restaurants to suit the international palate. But the lobby lounge is a feast for the eye designed, as it was, around that glorious view of the Taj Mahal.
